intro: Fordiophyton huizhouense, commonly known as the Huizhou bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
